intro: Cymbopappus piliferus, commonly known as the hairy corymbifera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its growth form is usually low and spreading, with woody stems that help it survive in dry climates. The species is also known for its ability to thrive in sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland dunes.
